medical_history.chief_complaint: Abdominal pain, nausea, vomiting, and hypertension urgency.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient was admitted with symptoms including abdominal pain, nausea, and vomiting. Blood pressure was significantly elevated initially at around 250/XX mmHg but was reduced with labetalol and home medications. The symptoms showed improvement as the patient was in no apparent distress (NAD) upon presentation, with no pain and no nausea.
medical_history.past_medical_history: End-stage renal disease (ESRD) from diabetes, diabetic foot ulcers, alcohol-induced elevation of liver function tests (LFTs), hypertension, hyperlipidemia, diabetic myonecrosis.
medical_history.family_history: Significant for diabetes; both parents have Type 2 diabetes mellitus (DMII), two sisters have Type 1 diabetes mellitus (DMI), and older brothers also have DMI. All grandparents had diabetes. No family history of heart disease, hypertension, cancer, or bleeding disorders.
medical_history.social_history: History of alcohol use. Not specified regarding smoking or other lifestyle factors.
